subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
Redox Signaling Dysregulation and Cysteine Deficiency Theory
Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as signaling molecules inducing hormetic adaptive responses that promote longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS as signaling agents triggering protective pathways and lifespan extension via mitohormesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy induced by mitochondrial ROS as a hormetic mechanism promoting longevity and mitochondrial quality control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details hormetic ROS signaling from mitochondria activating energy-sensing pathways and mitochondrial biogenesis to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial respiration and ROS production to aging and highlights dietary restriction and antioxidants protecting mitochondria.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on reducing mitochondrial ROS generation to delay aging, highlighting mitochondrial function modulation and antioxidant enhancement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes an inverted U-shaped dose-response of ROS, emphasizing the dual signaling and damaging roles of mitochondrial ROS in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Identifies motorneurons as critical cells where mitochondrial ROS-mediated damage limits lifespan, linking mitochondrial ROS to organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction as both source and target of ROS causing oxidative damage and tissue dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage to nuclear and mitochondrial DNA as a primary cause of aging, highlighting DNA repair pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links antioxidant enzyme activity and DNA repair capacity to longevity, focusing on oxidative DNA damage and repair mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details oxidative damage to proteins and DNA, with calorie restriction reducing damage and extending lifespan, emphasizing molecular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage causing aging and modulation of redox-sensitive transcription factors like AP-1 influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress and antioxidant enzyme deficiency causing accelerated aging, with dietary restriction reducing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links ROS from mitochondrial and non-mitochondrial sources to oxidative damage and aging, emphasizing redox imbalance and glutathione depletion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Peroxisomal Catalase Deficiency and ROS Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on peroxisomal catalase deficiency causing ROS accumulation, lipid oxidation, and accelerated aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Signaling Dysregulation and Cysteine Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes redox-sensitive signaling dysregulation due to oxidative stress and cysteine/glutathione deficiency driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Signaling Dysregulation and Cysteine Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes redox imbalance causing aging via oxidative stress and molecular inflammation, highlighting dual roles of reactive species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS accumulation causing damage and decline in antioxidant defenses as causal in aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS accumulation causing damage and the role of endogenous and exogenous antioxidants in mitigating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights enhancement of antioxidant defenses and genetic regulation of stress response pathways reducing oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows dose-dependent effects of oxidative stress and antioxidant defense mechanisms modulating lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative damage by free radicals to aging and correlates antioxidant system efficiency with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS accumulation causing oxidative stress and damage, with antioxidant defenses modulating healthful aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress imbalance and antioxidant defense decline with aging, and calorie restriction reducing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress-induced proteasome dysfunction in immune cells to aging, highlighting feedback loops exacerbating damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Lesion Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes hormetic roles of 8-oxoG oxidative DNA lesions in gene expression regulation and adaptive responses to oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SKN-1/Nrf2 Antioxidant Signaling and Geroprotection Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SKN-1/Nrf2 pathway activation by oxidative stress to induce antioxidant defenses and promote longevity and neuroprotection.
